episodeTitle: Take To The Sky! Ride The Knock-Up Stream!
episodeTitleJapanese: 船は空をゆく！突き上げる海流（ノックアップストリーム）に乗れ
episodeTitleRomanized: Fune wa Sora o Yuku! Nokku Appu Sutorīmu ni Nore
description: The Going Merry receives crucial modifications with wings to prepare for the dangerous ascent. As the Knock-Up Stream erupts, the Straw Hats ride the massive geyser toward Skypiea while the Blackbeard Pirates reveal Luffy and Zoro's new bounties before being swept away by the powerful current.

events.title: Final Preparations and Farewell to Cricket
events.description: The Straw Hat Pirates complete final preparations on the Going Merry, now modified with wings and chicken decorations. Cricket and his crew prepare to guide them to the Knock-Up Stream location.
events.significance: Marks the conclusion of the alliance with Mont Blanc Cricket and the Saruyama Alliance, ending the Jaya Arc storyline.

quotes.text: Thanks for everything, old man! We'll make it to Sky Island!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's gratitude to Cricket before departure

events.title: Going Merry's Wing Modifications Revealed
events.description: The Going Merry's transformation is fully revealed, featuring large wings attached to the sides and a chicken-themed figurehead modification to enhance flight capability for the Knock-Up Stream journey.
events.significance: Essential modification that allows the Going Merry to successfully reach Skypiea, demonstrating the Saruyama Alliance's shipwright skills.

events.title: Arrival at Knock-Up Stream Location
events.description: The Straw Hats, guided by Masira and Shoujou's diving crew, reach the designated area where the Knock-Up Stream will erupt. They observe the formation of a massive whirlpool signaling the stream's imminent emergence.
events.significance: Sets the stage for the dangerous journey to Skypiea and demonstrates Nami's navigational challenge.

quotes.text: That whirlpool is the sign! The Knock-Up Stream is about to blow!
quotes.speaker: Masira
quotes.context: Identifying the precursor to the Knock-Up Stream

events.title: Blackbeard Pirates' Pursuit
events.description: The Blackbeard Pirates arrive on their raft, pursuing the Straw Hats. Blackbeard declares his intention to capture Luffy for his bounty, revealing his awareness of the crew's increased value.
events.significance: First direct confrontation attempt between Blackbeard and Luffy since their encounter in Mock Town, foreshadowing their future rivalry.

quotes.text: Zehahahaha! I'm here for your 100 million berry head, Straw Hat!
quotes.speaker: Marshall D. Teach
quotes.context: Blackbeard's declaration of intent to capture Luffy

events.title: Luffy's 100 Million Berry Bounty Revealed
events.description: Blackbeard displays Luffy's new bounty poster showing 100,000,000 berries, a massive increase from his previous 30 million bounty following the Arabasta incident.
events.significance: Marks Luffy's rise as a significant threat in the Grand Line and the World Government's recognition of his role in defeating Crocodile.

quotes.text: One hundred million?! When did that happen?!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's shocked reaction to his new bounty

quotes.text: It must be from what happened in Arabasta!
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Nami deducing the reason for the bounty increase

events.title: Zoro's First Bounty: 60 Million Berries
events.description: Blackbeard reveals Zoro's first bounty poster showing 60,000,000 berries, making it the highest first bounty from the East Blue and recognition of his defeat of Daz Bones.
events.significance: Establishes Zoro as a major threat and breaks the record for highest first bounty from the East Blue, previously held by Luffy.

quotes.text: Sixty million for me? Not bad for a start.
quotes.speaker: Zoro
quotes.context: Zoro's casual reaction to his first bounty

events.title: Sanji's Disappointment Over No Bounty
events.description: Sanji frantically asks Usopp to check if he also received a bounty poster, but is disappointed to learn there isn't one for him yet.
events.significance: Running gag establishing Sanji's desire for recognition and rivalry with Zoro over bounties.

events.title: The Knock-Up Stream Erupts
events.description: A massive explosion occurs beneath the ocean surface as the Knock-Up Stream erupts, creating a colossal vertical geyser that launches both the Going Merry and the Blackbeard Pirates' raft into the air.
events.significance: The pivotal moment that propels the Straw Hats to Skypiea and saves them from Blackbeard's attack.

quotes.text: Hold on everyone! This is it!
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Nami alerting the crew as the stream erupts

events.title: Blackbeard Pirates' Raft Destroyed
events.description: The Blackbeard Pirates' makeshift raft is completely destroyed by the force of the Knock-Up Stream, leaving the crew stranded in the ocean while the Straw Hats ascend.
events.significance: Prevents the first major confrontation between Blackbeard and Luffy, postponing their inevitable clash to a future arc.

events.title: Riding the Knock-Up Stream
events.description: The Going Merry successfully catches the Knock-Up Stream and begins its vertical ascent toward the sky. The crew holds on as the ship rockets upward through the massive water column.
events.significance: Beginning of the journey to Skypiea and one of the most visually spectacular moments in the series.

events.title: Nami's Expert Navigation
events.description: As the Going Merry begins to lose contact with the Knock-Up Stream and starts falling, Nami calmly directs the crew to release the sails, demonstrating her exceptional navigation skills.
events.significance: Showcases Nami's critical role as navigator and her ability to stay calm under extreme pressure.

quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Nami's navigation command during the critical moment

events.title: Going Merry Takes Flight
events.description: The Going Merry's wings catch the wind and the ship begins to fly alongside the Knock-Up Stream rather than riding directly on it, demonstrating the effectiveness of Masira and Shoujou's modifications.
events.significance: Proves the modifications were essential and showcases the Going Merry's adaptability as the Straw Hats' ship.

quotes.text: We're flying! The ship is really flying!
quotes.speaker: Usopp
quotes.context: Usopp's amazement as the Going Merry takes flight

events.title: Approaching the Millennium Cumulonimbus
events.description: The Going Merry approaches the massive Millennium Cumulonimbus cloud where Skypiea is believed to exist. The crew prepares for entry into the unknown territory above the clouds.
events.significance: Transition from the Blue Sea to the White Sea, marking the beginning of the Skypiea Arc and the exploration of a completely new type of location in the One Piece world.

quotes.text: Skypiea should be beyond those clouds!
quotes.speaker: Nami

events.title: Farewell to the Blue Sea
events.description: The Going Merry passes through the clouds, leaving the Blue Sea behind as the crew enters the White Sea above. This marks the final moment of the Jaya Arc.
events.significance: Symbolizes the Straw Hats' entry into uncharted territory and the beginning of one of the most unique arcs in One Piece.

quotes.text: Zehahahaha! I'm here for your 100 million berry head, Straw Hat!
quotes.speaker: Marshall D. Teach

quotes.text: One hundred million?! When did that happen?!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's shocked reaction to his bounty increase

quotes.text: It must be from what happened in Arabasta!
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Explaining the reason for the bounty increases

quotes.text: Hold on everyone! This is it!
quotes.speaker: Nami

quotes.text: We're flying! The ship is really flying!
quotes.speaker: Usopp
quotes.context: Amazement as the Going Merry takes flight

quotes.text: Skypiea should be beyond those clouds!
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Identifying their destination in the sky

themes.description: The episode embodies the spirit of adventure as the Straw Hats literally leap into the unknown, riding a massive geyser to reach an island in the sky that most people believe doesn't exist.
themes.symbolism: The Knock-Up Stream represents taking a leap of faith and pursuing dreams despite danger and skepticism.

themes.description: The crew must work together perfectly to survive the Knock-Up Stream, with each member playing their role and trusting Nami's navigation expertise.
themes.symbolism: The modified Going Merry represents how preparation and teamwork enable achieving the impossible.

themes.description: The perfectly timed eruption of the Knock-Up Stream saves the Straw Hats from Blackbeard while propelling them to Skypiea, suggesting fate's role in their journey.
themes.symbolism: The natural phenomenon occurring at the exact moment needed suggests destiny guiding their path.

characterSpotlights.development: Nami demonstrates her exceptional navigation skills under extreme pressure, making split-second decisions that save the crew and guide them successfully to Skypiea.
keyActions: Directs the crew to the Knock-Up Stream location
Calmly instructs the crew to release sails at the critical moment
Successfully navigates the ship through the ascent
quotes: Hold on everyone! This is it!
Skypiea should be beyond those clouds!

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy learns of his dramatically increased bounty, marking his rise as a significant pirate in the Grand Line.
keyActions: Prepares the crew for the dangerous journey
Leads the crew into the sky
quotes: Thanks for everything, old man! We'll make it to Sky Island!
One hundred million?! When did that happen?!

characterSpotlights.development: Zoro receives his first bounty of 60 million berries, establishing him as a major threat and breaking East Blue bounty records.
quotes: Sixty million for me? Not bad for a start.

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extends the scene of the Going Merry flying with the wings, adding more dramatic shots of the ship in flight compared to the manga.
The anime adds additional reaction shots from various crew members as they ascend, particularly focusing on Chopper's fear and Luffy's excitement.

trivia.fact: This is the final episode of the Jaya Arc and marks the transition to the Skypiea Arc.
Zoro's 60 million berry first bounty broke the record for the highest first bounty from the East Blue, a record previously held by Luffy at 30 million.

sources.title: List of Bounties - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: The episode adapts chapters 235 and 236 of the manga.
An excerpt of the first opening song 'We Are!' plays in the background during the flying scene, creating a nostalgic callback to the series' beginning.
The episode had a 13.9% TV rating in Japan and ranked 5th in its timeslot.
